items.title: 50 pounds for two adults
items.review_text:
Well all I can say is we spent half an hour at a station with nothing to do but watch Brian and his other train buddy's stuff there face with chocolate cake and sandwiches for half an hour.
As paying customers I do not appreciate waiting for staff to have there lunch.
Also this train experience is not what it's cracked up to be.

items.title: The fabulous Slate Trail
items.review_text:
What an amazing day on Thursday (21/09/23) riding The Slate Trail in the company of my dear friend & our carriage companions (the Lamberts). All the staff were authentically dressed & what struck me most throughout the entire 5 hour experience as they hopped in and out of carriages to share their knowledge was their pride in & care about their railway & its history. There were stops to be let out , with the beautifully kept steam locomotive & its 1860 original carriages backed up so that riders could video and photograph its approach. Being in a small carriage in a railway cutting meant that the kind of big views you’d maybe get on a good day on the Snowdonia railway we’re missing but there were some pretty waterfalls with the purest water you could imagine. We were given a tour of the engine sheds (working) & access to the museum
after which we were served a cream tea which I was so so looking forward to however, and here is where it went south. Nowhere had it been mentioned that the scones were to be fruit and that plain were not an option. I was gutted! What a magic day. I’d highly recommend the day if you are in mid/north wales and in particular we enjoyed the pleasant company of tour guide Mrs Kez Jones.

items.title: Great day but....
items.review_text: All was fantastic till we reached the other end, a really old lady and a sergeant major spoke harshly and treated us like cattle loading us onto carriage after only 15 mins break! That we found very not professional but the rest of the staff where lovely.

items.title: Fabulous monumental scenery
items.review_text: Fabulous scenery, smiling helpful volunteers. An enjoyable safe experience. Maybe the views at the  end could have been more exciting. Lovely cafe, the toilets couldn’t have been better organised re Covid  safety. A bit pricey maybe.

items.title: A great experience.
items.review_text: A most enjoyable visit to this heritage railway. It was good to see the old working narrow guage steam railway and the scenery, even on a wet day, was stunning. Originally used to  bring slate down from the quarries it became a tourist railway when the slate quarries closed. The covid 19 precautions were superb and we always felt safe. The volunteers are always ready to talk of their work, the history of the railway and of the engines. Don't hesitate to ask questions. This would have been a 5 star review but for the grumpy staff in the cafe at Tywyn.

items.title: Purchase of Talyllyn control centre
items.review_text: Purchase of Talyllyn control centre: Good functionality, occasionaly trains seem to go off line when they are still on the track. Is there any way of listing the makeup of, eg, the engineers train?

items.title: A day trip to the Talyllyn on 2nd of June 2021
items.review_text: We found the Talyllyn and the teams on duty as welcoming and engaging as ever. Covid measures were evidently in place and adhered to. The carriages and locos were spotless and the journey up the line showed that lots of work had been put into maintaining the hedgerows and banks. We ate in the Kings Cafe and thoroughly enjoyed our family day out, topped by chatting to Stuart Williams and his team.

items.title: Delighted Yorkshire visitors!
items.review_text: Talking to Lorraine, I was booking a party of nine working volunteers from the Keighley & Worth Valley Railway for the whole line trip on 27th June. We've yet to travel but the booking experience couldn't have been better. Just hope we might get a shed tour as well that she has requested on our behalf.

items.title: Highly recommendable
items.review_text: Excellent visit.  A good website made it easy to book in advance.  We were greeted in person on arrival and the staff we encountered were helpful.  The train journey was particularly enjoyable - possibly even more so under the 'social distancing' regime as we virtually had the carriage to ourselves.  It would have been nice to have been able to spend longer at Abergynolwyn but we could understand why this was not possible.  All in all, a great day out.

items.title: Thumbs up.
items.review_text: Everyone was really nice and friendly and did everything to make our trip enjoyable. Except providing good weather. Loved the fact we were hauled by a loco actually purchased for the railway when originally  being set up. Carriage COVID partitioning good and discrete.

items.title: A fantastic day and and well organised…
items.review_text: A fantastic day and and well organised from the moment we arrived until we left. Felt very covid safe, clean, good social distancing and knew way systems. Lovely pasty when the train stopped and quick service online with the 30 minutes we had at the station. Great staff who were all really helpful and i would highly recommend.

items.title: Covid safe trip not to be missed …
items.review_text: We have been on the Talyllyn Railway twice this week with my 3 year old son and neither trip disappointed. The staff are so friendly and genuinely happy to be there. It was 100% Covid safe and well managed by having a compartment per family. The sausage rolls and tea at Abergynolwyn Station aren’t to be missed either. Thanks again Talyllyn we will be back soon.

items.title: My partner and I miss dearly coming to…
items.review_text:
My partner and I miss dearly coming to Wales to the Tallylyhn railway.We never go anywhere else on holiday and my partner is also a volunteer and he has been for many years.
It is a precious treasure , preserved & cared for with love , knowledge and respect for a hardworking inspiring nostalgic past.
The shop manages to cope well on line with incredibly prompt responses in a very difficult time for all.

items.title: The Best Preserved Railway.
items.review_text:
The Best Preserved Railway.
I have been a member for at least forty years and the TR is the best preserved railway in the world. You can tell immediately you arrive, everyone you meet has a welcoming smile, even when it's raining. 
       However I have to say the on line reservation procedure when it came to paying and adding a donation became a little complex for an old 89 year member who hates computers. I think I managed it in the end, but I still wasn't sure that you were going to benefit by the extra 20% tax refund I declared?
       Please I have a simple question. As a Heritage member how do I go about increasing my monthly direct debit donation? The railway certainly needs some extra financial help right now!

items.title: 5* experience
items.review_text:
Even with all the restrictions in place still did not spoil our enjoyment. Well organized with friendly staff
We grew up going on train rides when visiting our Grandparents and it is great that volunteers enable this attraction to still be going 40+ years laters

Thank you one and all.

items.title: Christmas card approval..
items.review_text: Just very pleased to once again be able to buy Christmas cards from the railway.  These are sent to all of my friends and earlier customers in the miniature railway world here in Norway and the cards are a very welcome entity for the receivers at Christmas time judging by their comments. The cards are also very reasonable compared to Norwegian ones...

items.title: Fantastic calendar delivered in good…
items.review_text:
Fantastic calendar delivered in good time!
One thing I would say is that it'd be nice to know the delivery dates as I didnt know how long it would take.

items.title: Fabulous trip.  What wonderful volunteers!!  Thanks all.
items.review_text:
Everyone was so welcoming and friendly.  They have a great set up to allow social distancing.  The views are amazing and it's just a great opportunity to chill out from the hum drum of our busy lives and appreciate the beauty in nature.
Don't forget to select 'gift aid' when you purchase your ticket. 
Thanks all, loved it!!

items.title: In spite of the necessary covid…
items.review_text: In spite of the necessary covid precautions, the railway was running as well as ever, with friendly and helpful staff and a well turned out train and locomotive (no 7 on this occasion).  The other train was hauled by an equally immaculate no 3.  My wife and I had a very enjoyable trip, and a good lunch at the Wharf station cafe on our return.  Because of covid, this was my first sight of working steam for 6 months, and could not have been more appropriate in this 70th anniversary year of railway preservation.

items.title: Order despatched efficiently despite…
items.review_text:
Order despatched efficiently despite coronavirus and Lockdown.

Due to these circumstances I asked for notification item was on its way, and email was duly received. 

When purchase arrived (calendar), it was of good quality, and I'll probably repeat purchase in future years.

Thanks to sales department all round.

Regards to railway!

items.title: Excellent service!
items.review_text: Everything came quickly and was packed safely! I got an apron, bookmark, and a mug in the same package within 2-3 weeks of ordering. A little disappointed that the bookmark wasn't protected from being bent in any way, but other than that everything was great!

items.title: A Wondeful Little Train of Wales!
items.review_text: I've always been pleased to deal with the Talyllyn Railway - had so many good times traveling on their wonderful little trains.  All the staff I've had pleasure meeting over the years have been lovely, very friendly and eager to help you have a good time.  Even my dogs over the years have been made especially welcome and have enjoyed their trips too!  The scenery is wonderful and the journey is very relaxing - a lovely way to get away from it all for a few hours!!  Will be going again later in the year, taking a friend with me who hasn't been before, plus my current little dog who hasn't done the trip either.  Can't wait!!

items.title: Talyllyn Railway
items.review_text: I have an association with the Talyllyn Railway from when I was a very young boy back in the 60’s. Will be back in June 2021, COVID permitting, and stress this is a wonderful day, provided by wonderful people, on a piece of heritage which is a first class and much loved tribute to the Railways of yester year. If in the area, the Talyllyn Railway is a must.........

items.title: Excellent morning
items.review_text: Excellent Covid secure compartments, station and staff and amazing scenery. We hopped off (and got back on later) at Dolgoch and walked to see the waterfalls, which was well worth the effort and was lovely. All in all, an excellent morning.

items.title: Started the day with breakfast in the…
items.review_text: Started the day with breakfast in the station cafe before travelling on the 10:30am train. Great scenery throughout the whole journey. Back for lunch in the cafe before catching the 2:05pm train. Was able to see scenes which I had missed on the first journey. Very relaxing. Staff on train and in cafe so friendly and helpful. Great start to my holiday. Covid regulations followed by railway.

items.title: A GREAT AFTERNOON
items.review_text:
My husband and I travelled on the steam train last week, and found it to be a very enjoyable and safe experience. Our pre-booked carriage had our name on the window, so we knew where we were meant to be. There was a plastic screen between us and the next carriage, and the next carriage was left empty for our trip. We had also pre-booked a hamper each, which was brought to our carriage before the train departed. Each hamper contained a sandwich, crisps, a sausage roll, two mini quiches, a salad bowl, and a bottle of water, which I considered great value for £8.50. The 2½ hour return journey include a break where refreshments were available, and time for some fresh air.
All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.

items.title: Still the friendly Talyllyn in these odd times
items.review_text: The Talyllyn have done a really good job of putting safety measures in place but keeping the friendly quintessentially Talyllyn experience. The trains almost feel like private charters and the cream tea set out at Abergynolwyn is a must, a very good value add-on.

items.title: Wonderful
items.review_text: A wonderful example of a small organisation and its people pulling out all the stops to give customers an experience which very closely resembles a non-coronavirus situation, but with all the safety measures in place. Brilliant. I would recommend it to anybody. The staff were a delight.

items.title: Fantastic trip
items.review_text: We enjoyed the trip very much! The train was clean, the views were stunning and the journey was pleasant. Our daughter , 6 years old, enjoyed the trip as well and she recognised some features from Thomas the tank engine stories that she loves very much. We highly recommend the trip to everyone!

items.title: A must for everyone
items.review_text: Everything about this railway is great, if ever you are in the are it is a must even if you have no interest in steam trains! The atmosphere is fantastic and the shop at Wharf is a delight! Lots of really interesting books for the enthusiast and the Day tripper.

items.title: So glad that the trains are back…
items.review_text: So glad that the trains are able to run again! So well organised and everything in place for a safe and enjoyable trip. Each pre-booked party gets their own private compartment, separated from the others by screens. The COVID precautions taken made us feel very safe and comfortable on our visit. Lots of friendly people around to make sure you know where to go/what to do. We had a lovely trip and a great take away coffee and cake from the cafe! Thank you all.

items.title: Lots of help for my brother with additional needs
items.review_text: wonderful service, very helpful in booking a carriage for my disabled brother and his family and carers. Fantastic train ride, very comfy and amazing views. We all really enjoyed the trip. Will come again :)

items.title: I haven't been on the train yet, so please stop asking me for a review!
items.review_text: Why do you keep asking my for my review? I booked the train for next month, so I haven't had an experience yet!

items.title: Amazing day out
items.review_text: We come to talyllyn frequently with our 3 children 2 of whom have additional needs. We are always welcomed and absolutely love coming here. They really go the extra mile to make you feel welcome.

items.title: Giving the limitations with Covid-19…
items.review_text:
Giving the limitations with Covid-19 they are doing a great job,

I great journey in our own compartment behind Tom Rolt.

The only slight downside is the lack of accessible disabled parking at the Wharf Station,

items.title: A lovely few hours on a rainy day
items.review_text: We had a lovely few hours at the railway, even though it was a rainy day. Staff were friendly and efficient and precautions for the COVID-19 pandemic were well thought out and worked well. We had a snack halfway through the journey and service and quality were good here too.

items.title: Fantastic railway with a special feel…
items.review_text: Fantastic railway with a special feel and people. One round trip and three meals in kings - and all in complete safety given current circumstances. Thanks to everyone involved! Diolch!

items.title: A railway is a railway (30 years in…
items.review_text: A railway is a railway (30 years in track design). In these difficult times I wish to try and convey the care and the personal touches with which my family and I were treated. The service was brilliant, pre-order the cream tea, and a lovely lady emails you personally for your drinks order! Its very clean place to visit. The carriages are separated internally, that's your compartment!!! and off you go! Will come back when you can walk at the top of the line, but for now great day out.

items.title: Booking Members tickets.
items.review_text: We wanted to book a members ticket for a ride on the TR in June, and unable to do this on the website I phoned the booking office at Wharf. Our request was dealt with efficiently and an email confirming the tickets arrived quickly.

items.title: A very good experience
items.review_text: A very good experience. We were made to feel welcome and the Covid control measures were very good. We enjoyed the railway and the short walk we had at the top.

items.title: Brilliant organisation
items.review_text:
Brilliant organisation to ensure a safe and enjoyable day. All members of TR staff exceptionally pleasant, polite and helpful. 
Lovely weather on the day as well, resulting  in a great experience!
Our thanks to all involved
Robin Whitworth
Alan Bradley

items.title: Great day out
items.review_text: Great day out, well worth the money. Covid secure with our own compartment. Lovely touch with the food/drink voucher for use in the cafe. Will definitely recommend to anyone we know visiting the area. Thank you.

items.title: Good old traditional politeness and a great experience
items.review_text: Took my family of five on another trip on the Talyllyn Railway, booked the tickets on line and we were given a compartment. As usual the staff were lovely, polite, friendly and extremely helpful. I would highly recommend the experience

items.title: A Grand Day Out
items.review_text:
I ordered over the phone and spoke with a very helpful lady. We were able to book a compartment at the time and on the date we needed.
Especially given the restrictions in place lately, we had a really good trip along the line and back in our compartment - there was plenty of space for us (two adults, one child plus his pushchair and paraphenalia, and one dog).

Two locos in steam and even the weather was superb!

Thanks to all involved!

items.title: Items arrived neatly wrapped and…
items.review_text: Items arrived neatly wrapped and reasonably prompt. We wish you best of luck during this terrible time and look forward to returning when things are back to normal.

items.title: Always a pleasure dealing…
items.review_text:
Always a pleasure dealing with/volunteering with the TR.  Although the parcel has not arrived yet, I am sure everything will be up to your usual high standards.

Thanks again and keep well.

Gerald Lapointe

items.title: Fascinating👍social distancing at…
items.review_text: Fascinating👍social distancing at stations & on trains👍.            good food😋friendly, helpful staff😀glorious views up to Cader ldris and out to sea to Bardsey/Ynys Enlli😍value for money👏repeat visit😁

items.title: A great day out with some spectacular…
items.review_text: A great day out with some spectacular views followed by a lovely cream tea. We went back the following day and completed one of the many walks from the other train stations.

items.title: This will be our second lockdown…
items.review_text:
This will be our second lockdown experience of the railway journey and facilities and I have found it excellent
Staff are helpful and arrangements are good at the stations, on the road  train and at the cafewell worth it, thank you

items.title: The Talyllyn Railway Control Center
items.review_text: The Talyllyn Railway control center is worth every penny, it gives an insight into the operation of the railway, but be warned it is addictive, you find that you keep returning to it over and over again. I can't wait until they start the regular services.

items.title: Fabulous family afternoon
items.review_text: We had a lovely afternoon out on the steam train, we were very lucky to be upgraded to first class as well which was a lovely surprise! The food at the cafe was very tasty and all of the staff throughout the day were very helpful! We would definitely recommend this day out to people.

items.title: We'll worth a visit.
items.review_text:
We've been coming here since our children were little (our eldest is now 27) & never had a bad experience.
Well worth a visit.
Lovely staff & food.
Great to see it open again. We love hearing the engines 'poop' while we sit in our garden.

items.title: Brilliant day out
items.review_text: Brilliant day out, felt safe, staff were helpful and knowledgable, even the terrible weather didnt spoil the day. Covid precautions are all spot on.

items.title: The package arrived quickly
items.review_text: The package arrived quickly, was complete with all I ordered, and I am very happy with the quality of the goods.  The sweets and biscuits are doing nothing for my waistline, but that's not Talyllyn's problem.  Good service.

items.title: Great experience
items.review_text:
Great experience,  very friendly and knowledgeable staff, still a good day out even with all the covid restrictions in place.
Can recommend and would go again.

items.title: Great fun morning out
items.review_text:
Great fun morning out, beautiful views from the train, and friendly helpful staff. We loved watching the red kites. 
Great beef stew in the cafe afterwards, too. Would recommend.

items.title: extra camera etc
items.review_text: Singed up for the extra camera etc- no problem.  I would willingly pay for extra cameras etc just to keep an eye on things until a visit is possible.

items.title: Brilliant day, stunning railway with fantastic views, fantastic value for money!
items.review_text:
I had a fantastic day on Talyllyn railway with my family of 6. At a cost of £66 for a trip along the whole line for all 6 of us It was a bargain, even more so when you factor in the £5 drinks voucher. 

For me what made it the biggest bargain was that the same family of 6 would have to have paid £126 for the same length of ride in coaches which where not as nice on the Ffestiniog Railway. 

As a driver on another heritage railway, and steam enthusiasts. I think Talyllyn system for a steam railways in the age of covid is the gold standard of how to do it! 

I’d also like to thank the guard on the 14:10 train on Tuesday the 29th of September, as my 2 year old nephew had a little accident after picking up a hot drink. She was so helpful, understanding and sprinted to get ice for him. He left the railway non the worse for ware and with a big smile on his face, like the rest of us :) 

Thank you Talyllyn Iv Fallen in love with your railway :) 


Matthew Armstrong of Norwich

items.title: A birthday treat
items.review_text: Very pleased with Stuart who booked our trip for us. He was polite, considerate and helpful. A credit to Talyllyn. He explained our trip and didn’t give me the hard sell. We are looking forward to the trip. See you on 9th December.

items.title: We love the personal approach at…
items.review_text: We love the personal approach at Talyllyn Railway. Flexible and helpful and tasty food hampers make it a twice yearly family treat for us

items.title: Excellent customer service and experience
items.review_text: I had to make quite a few changes to my booking - and all were received with grace and kindness and efficiency. Excellent people to deal with, and we had a magical day out.

items.title: The Talyllyn is my Favourite Railway
items.review_text: The Talyllyn has been my favourite welsh NG railway since my teenage years in the 50's having read Tom Rolt's book.

items.title: Very safe
items.review_text: Very safe, and a very welcoming railway. Even the General Manager was out and about on the platform talking to visitors and making sure all was well. Highly recommended.

items.title: I ordered a calendar from Talyllyn and…
items.review_text: I ordered a calendar from Talyllyn and it came a day earlier than it said it would, so good service, and we were very pleased with our purchase, the pictures are lovely.

items.title: We love this little train even if we…
items.review_text: We love this little train even if we are silver surfers🏄‍♀️🏄‍♂️🤥. Its a great train ride up past waterfalls & woodlands. Staff are always friendly and helpful and there is a cafe too although we didn't use it this time. It makes you feel free & happy....go do it!

items.title: Lovely day out
items.review_text: Lovely day out. The whole day was very well-organised, Covid notwithstanding. Food from the cafe was good. All of the staff and volunteers were friendly and helpful. Thank you.

items.title: The railway is a wonderful place
items.review_text: The railway is a wonderful place.  I’m so appreciative of the many volunteers.  They are so committed. We truly enjoyed our visit.  Thank you

items.title: Great family day out...
items.review_text:
We had a great family day out at the Talyllyn a few days ago!!
Thanks to everyone involved for getting back up and running in difficult times.

items.title: Ordered my 2021 calendar from you…
items.review_text: Ordered my 2021 calendar from you online. Exceptionally easy. Arrived very quickly. Good value for money & I know have images of the Railway to take me through 2021.

items.title: well organised
items.review_text:
well organised. friendly and polite volunteer staff, 
lovely locos and rolling stock
a good day out despite the pandemic. Well done!

items.title: Good service from Stuart who obviously…
items.review_text: Good service from Stuart who obviously knew what he was doing. All contact both now and in the past has been excellent.

items.title: Really lovely day
items.review_text:
Really lovely day, staff were all brilliant, polite and helpful. The welsh afternoon tea was delicious. 
Highly recommended for a family outing

items.title: A return visit.
items.review_text: A return visit to the world's first preserved railway. A wonderful experience. Friendly, helpful staff, immaculate loco and rolling stock and a journey through beautiful Welsh countryside.

items.title: Sent off for the 2021 calender and Xmas…
items.review_text: Sent off for the 2021 calender and Xmas card. Arrived very quickly, very good calender, but the cards very boring, even more boring than the Corris railway cards.

items.title: Excellent organisation throughout
items.review_text:
Excellent organisation throughout, our 2nd visit during the pandemic.
The railway operates through a stunning area of natural beauty, trains (locomotives and carriages) are not just clean but immaculately presented, 
Our party comprised of a disabled lady and a baby in a pushchair. The staff / volunteers were excellent throughout, ensuring the safety of a vulnerable person. Social distancing measures were exemplary, including Shop, Cafe and Toilet arrangements, for both able bodied and disabled visitors 
The Talyllyn Railway could teach far larger organisations how running your business can be done and should be done in these unprecedented times.

items.title: Very well arranged
items.review_text: Very well arranged. I felt safe but more staff could wear masks. Popular cafe. everyone was enjoying themselves.

items.title: Great value for money
items.review_text: Great value for money, lovely trip and amazing scenery.  Great customer service , particularly during the situation we are in- well done, would defiantly revisit

items.title: A great trip out
items.review_text: We had an excellent time. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and our cream teas were waiting for us upon arrival. My toddler loved riding on the ‘choo choo’!

items.title: Really nice train trip and staff
items.review_text: Really nice train trip and staff. Service was better than expected during this difficult time of vivid restrictions.

items.title: Excellent little railway
items.review_text: Excellent little railway gone to Grate lengths to keep their customers safe. This little railway deserves to be supported.

items.title: Would have liked to see monthly photos…
items.review_text: Would have liked to see monthly photos on website but very pleased with the calendar's quality and picture content, however it was posted in a standard envelope (not cardboard) and it arrived a little creased so just something for the future.

items.title: Had a lovely day out
items.review_text: Had a lovely day out, staff were very friendly and covid safe. Hampers and cream tea was a delightful touch to make the journey extra special.

items.title: Under the present and unusual…
items.review_text: Under the present and unusual circumstances your staff did an excellent job of keeping everybody safe and making the journey enjoyable.  Many thanks

items.title: Great day out
items.review_text: Great day out, great camera coverage. Good food too. With friendly staff/volunteers,  couldn't ask for more.

items.title: Excellent
items.review_text: Excellent, staff were very friendly, beautiful scenery, covid-19 safety measures were good, felt very safe

items.title: Shop always has interesting items
items.review_text: Goods are slightly expensive but arrived quickly and quality fine

items.title: Wonderful Day
items.review_text: Had a lovely journey, very mindful experience. Everybody was really helpful, the volunteers should be proud of their efforts, highly recommend.

items.title: It was fine
items.review_text: It was fine. Reasonably easy to follow once I got the hang of it. Took me a while but I am partially sighted so everything takes longer these days. Hope the railway keeps going so we might be a able to travel again this year.

items.title: A great experience
items.review_text: Always a pleasure to visit this lovely railway. The staff and volunteers are always professional and courteous. Well done to all.

items.title: Wonderful steam train ride
items.review_text: Wonderful steam train ride, ran by volunteers who are all very knowledgeable and helpful making the train ride even more fun and enjoyable

items.title: Had no problems with order.quick…
items.review_text: Had no problems with order.quick service.package well packed.will do business again in future.

items.title: Great friendly service and a beautiful…
items.review_text: Great friendly service and a beautiful trip in the very comfortable first class carriage , thank you x

items.title: Great service
items.review_text: Great service. Goods received in good time. Thanks and good luck working around COVID-19.

items.title: Fast and efficient
items.review_text:
Fast and efficient: my purchase arrived days sooner than I expected.
Well done, and thank you!

items.title: So grateful your shop is on line.
items.review_text: . Very helpful and reliable. A perfect lockdown presant for my grandson. As he loves visiting the shop.

items.title: Well organised with good social…
items.review_text: Well organised with good social distancing.  Booking was easy and staff very helpful on the day.

items.title: We were in North Wales for a holiday
items.review_text:
We were in North Wales for a holiday. 
Everyone that we met whilst travelling on the Talyllyn Railway were courteous, informative and adhering to the Covid 19 regulations scrupulously.
A very good experience and we would recommend it to everyone!

items.title: I wasn't able to find the 2021 calendar…
items.review_text: I wasn't able to find the 2021 calendar on the website, but with helpful, much appreciated, guidance I was able to locate and order it. They are truly splendid calendars with excellent photographs.

items.title: 2021 Calendar is excellent
items.review_text:
2021 Calendar is excellent
It arrived very quickly after order'
Good selection of images.
Thank you

items.title: great day out
items.review_text: great day out , Weather was awful but made no difference, so good to go on a rainy day !

items.title: Delighted that you provide this service…
items.review_text: Delighted that you provide this service . Everything from ordering to arrival of parcel was excellent.

items.title: Towyn on Sea
items.review_text: Just what I wanted. The perfect present for my wife. This book will help her find out about her relatives who used in live in Towyn a long time ago

items.title: Very prompt dispatch
items.review_text: Very prompt dispatch, expertly packed, excellent products and value from the online shop

items.title: Brilliant ride and scenery
items.review_text: Brilliant ride and scenery. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Staff members, all friendly and helpful.

items.title: Wonderful trip on this delightful…
items.review_text: Wonderful trip on this delightful little steam train. Covid 19 system working well to ensure visitors safety.

items.title: Lovely Cards
items.review_text:
These are very nice Christmas cards.
Delivery was very fast and the packaging was excellent.
I’m sure my friends will love them.

items.title: We had a lovely ride on the train
items.review_text: We had a lovely ride on the train. We would have liked to have got off and walked to the falls but because of Covid we were advised to return in same carriage! Next time!

items.title: Tuvimos un excelente tiempo
items.review_text: Tuvimos un excelente tiempo, todo el personal fue muy amable y el recorrido fue extraordinario... Gracias

items.title: A very warm welcome and a great…

items.title: Ride on the Talyllyn Railway 1st August Steam Train Special
items.review_text:
As a family group of five we were all delighted with our ride on the Talyllyn Railway. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. Instructions relating to COVID19 safety were very clear. 
Excellent food at Abergynolwyn station, with enough time to enjoy it before getting back into our designated compartment for the return journey.
Parking at Tywyn was very easy.
Journey on 1st August, 10:30 departure.
Very helpful email responses to a couple of queries prior to our visit

items.title: I ordered a rugby jersey
items.review_text: I ordered a rugby jersey, wishing to add to TR funds in the lockdown.   The parcel arrived two days later, also including the superb 2020 calendar.   The jersey is very comfortable and I enjoy strutting around to show off the TR logo. I am very impressed and grateful - though not surprised - at the excellent friendly service I received.  Full marks definitely.   I look forward to riding the TR, suitably dressed of course, as soon as possible.   All good wishes, thanks again Ken Veitch      Waterloo House, Greenhead, Northumberland CA8 7JT

items.title: We all love the Tickle Monster!
items.review_text: The Tickle Book was recommended by a very knowledgeable member of staff at Talyllyn Railway to entertain our 10 month old granddaughter during this lockdown period - and it is absolutely perfect! The rhyming story is short and interesting with so much detail in the illustrations there is always something new to spot. Our granddaughter loves turning the flaps to find the tickle monster! The board book is also sturdy and of great quality. The free delivery service was quick and efficient, so an added bonus!

A little Welsh Gem.
The Talyllyn Railway is a lovely railway to go & visit which travels through out stunning Scenery.I would defiantly recommend that you go & visit this railway as it is one our 1st preserved railways to be manned by volunteers.
It is also home to the engines that appear in the Thomas The Tank Engine Stories.

The website that the railway has is very easy to navigate and everything is well laid out and explained.

items.title: I have not travelled yet so cannot…
items.review_text: I have not travelled yet so cannot comment on the actual railway experience. What I can say is that booking an advance ticket by internet was not easy. The website needs strong revision, not intuitive. I did not get email confirmation of my booking. I spoke to one member of staff about this who confirmed I "was on the system" but could not send me an email to confirm, so I should call back the next day to speak to "Dan". I did call back and spoke to a woman who was very helpful and immediately sent the required email. Overall not a very re-assuring experience and I suspect their website might cost them some bookings.

items.title: 2020 calendar…
items.review_text: I recently purchased the 2020 calendar from Talyllyn Railway and am extremely satisfied with the service I received.  The most surprising thing was the speed with which the item was received.  I'd expected around a week and it took only two or three days.  Then there was the packaging.  I was not at home when the item was delivered by Royal Mail so the postman pushed the item, folded, through my rather small letterbox.  However, because the package was so substantial no damage has been sustained to the contents.  Oh yes, the calendar is fantastic, especially if like me you want to record appointments etc.

items.title: Great place for families!
items.review_text:
We went to Talyllyn Railway three times in a week. First time I took my daughter (which is 3 years old and not always easy to keep entertained) for a day out and she loved the experience. We stopped at one of the coffee shop and had a lovely hot chocolate and cake.
We then went back with the whole family for the Halloween event which was simply amazing! Great entertainment and settings and the staff couldn't have done more!
Last we went to the Talyllyn Railway for breakfast and that was excellent too :)
Would highly recommend! Definitely the best attraction in Tywyn!

items.title: Simple really.......Wonderful
items.review_text:
Simple really.......Wonderful

Brilliant day out.  Everything was as good as it gets.  The staff were all friendly, helpful and very efficient.  
The trains were spotless as were the buildings, platforms, loos and restaurant.
Food was delicious.
This was our second visit this year and ....we will be back!!

items.title: It was disappointing because unlike the…
items.review_text: It was disappointing because unlike the marketed experience, there was no scary story in the woods - just a very quick walk. The children were left disappointed. The fancy dress competition was also very rushed, and poorly managed.

items.title: We booked the Vintage train…
items.review_text: We booked onto the Victorian Vintage train with picnic hamper and wine. It was a great experience with knowledgeable and friendly staff. Also great for photo/video opportunities of the train as it backs up and rushes back into view whist we watch. Staggering scenery up at the end of the line beyond Nant Gwernol. Superb day out.

items.title: We spent a wonderful afternoon on the…
items.review_text: We spent a wonderful afternoon on the little train.  We paid for first class which was great.  The views are wonderful and for my Husband and I it was a time to forget the real world.  At Talyllyn Stations there is a lovely shop and café and the toilets are very good.   the same at Aberganolwyn where you can stretch your legs for about 20 mins on the return journey.  A great memory.

items.title: Enchanting journey on an old steam railway
items.review_text:
Really lovely few hours on the railway,with stunning scenery.
I was happy I could bring along the whole family, including my two labradors...they loved it too...being admired by a lot of dog-loving passengers.
The staff were very friendly and helpful, and nothing was too much bother for them- excellent! Thank you to all the staff:)
I’d included the cream tea in the train journey package, and was pleasantly surprised with an old-fashioned layout of the scones etc
It was all in all a lovely experience into the olden days travelling!
Loved it!

items.title: A day to remember plus 50 years !
items.review_text:
Despite continuous rain the staff and volunteers kept a happy outlook and kept the schedules.  It was good to ride the rails again , the last time was in my  20's with a group of children.    Over 50 years later I visited Talyllyn again and remembered we got off at the falls stop.

I had booked the Friday Fish & Chip meal and this was well organised
and a pleasurable experience.   Thanks to all staff.

items.title: Great rail journey into history
items.review_text:
I was impressed with the whole experience - wonderfully shining engines, dedicated volunteers at every small halt, fascinating facts on the literature, great cafe, interesting museum. 
Signage from Tywyn Station itself would have been helpful.

items.title: Gin & Swing trip.
items.review_text:
As always I enjoyed the train ride - can't beat it!
Gin & Swing was good but such a shame that Danny from Dyfi Dystillery wasn't given enough time to talk about each gin he makes and the interesting process of making it etc. It was too rushed at each gin stop and we missed out on one of the tastings as they'd run out of gin! 
The band were good and a very good 'value for money' evening.

items.title: Had a wonderful day out on the Talyllyn…
items.review_text: Had a wonderful day out on the Talyllyn Railway, with my granddaughter. Staff were brilliant, and tickets very reasonable.
